intro: Satureja schimperi, commonly known as Ethiopian thyme, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Its leaves are aromatic and contain essential oils, making it useful in traditional medicine and as a spice. Satureja schimperi thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
